author: Dave Burke For Mailonline
title: Germany launch MC1R magazine dedicated to redheads
text:
The magazine for redheads has attracted readers from around the world
A new magazine has been launched, which promises to 'deal with red hair and everything related to it'.
The publication, called MC1R , is the first of its type in the world.
Launched in Germany by 31-year-old Tristan Rodgers, it has a readership of thousands across the world.
It is named after Melanocortin 1 Receptor - one of the key proteins in regulating pigment production which lead to red hair.
Tristan said it started off as a photography project with a few friends, but he decided to see if there was enough interest to launch a magazine.
He said: 'Redheads are one of the smallest minorities all over the world and they have this special look almost every people see or react on.
'It is natural and in different cultures the people react on way you look, so if you are white with freckles and bright red hair, you may polarize in first. I don’t try to put a focus on discrimination or something like that, I think that was told enough with a lot of past projects people made.
It started off as a photography project, but editor Tristan Rodgers launched the magazine after a crowdfunding campaign in Germany
The magazine features photos of redheads, as well as articles of interest to those with ginger hair
'There are a lot of things redheads have in common, for example the special way how people use the hair in art and often redheads have this special kind of connection to this topic, so there is this special vibe I try to catch and reflect with this project.'
Since launching the magazine, he has discovered there are numerous redhead festivals and a large community interested in his work.
He plans to go to the Irish Redhead Convention, an annual celebration of all things ginger, later this year.
The magazine tackles the important questions that most matter to redheads
Tristan said he has discovered a large network of redheads around the world, and said the project is a positive thing
The magazine was set up to celebrate redheads, and has attracted an audience in countries across the world
The publication, launched in Germany, is the first in the world for redheads
Tristan, who lives in Hamburg, said: 'I discovered that a big network for, about and with redheads is coming up around the world and I am part of this movement now.
'The people connect more at festivals or with different kind of projects around the world and they share the experience they made with a lot of other people. Its a big positive hype right now and it’s cool for almost every redhead so see most of it on the media and everywhere else.'
But he said not everyone is on board. 'There are still a few redheads who don’t like the hype I think,' he stated, 'maybe because they get attention they don’t want or never had before, but it’s still a really good thing.'
